cz.syntea.xdef

Interface XDBuilder


  • public interface XDBuilder
    Provides building of XDPool. This object you need to use only in special case you want to make incremental building of XDPool. In most of cases you can create XDPool with static methods of XDFactory.

    Typical use of XDBuilder:

    
 // 1. Create XDBuilder with properties.
 Properties props = new Properties();
 props.setProperty(key, value); //see XDConstants
 ...
 XDBuilder buider = XDFactory.getXDBuilder(props);
 builder.setClassLoader(classloader); // set class loader for externals
 builder.setReporter(reporter); // set reporter for builder error reports
 builder.setExternals(externals); // set external objects
 ...
 builder.setSource(source 1); //compile source with X-definition
 ...
 builder.setSource(source n); //compile source with X-definition
 ...
 XDPool xd = builder.compileXD(); //build XDPool
 ...

    • Method Detail

      • setSource

        void setSource(java.lang.String source,
               java.lang.String sourceId)
        Add source data of X-definition or collection. If the argument starts with "<" character then it is interpreted as source X-definition data, otherwise it can be the pathname of the file or URL. If it is a pathname format then it may contain also wildcard characters representing a group of files.
        Parameters:
        source - The string with source X-definition.
        sourceId - name of source source data corresponding to the argument source (may be null).

      • setSource

        void setSource(java.lang.String... sources)
        Add source data of X-definitions or collections. If an item starts with "<" character then it is interpreted as source data, otherwise it can be the pathname of the file or URL. If it is a pathname format, then it may contain also wildcard characters representing a group of files.
        Parameters:
        sources - The string with sources.

      • setSource

        void setSource(java.lang.String[] sources,
               java.lang.String[] sourceIds)
        Add source data of X-definitions or collections. If an item starts with "<" character then it is interpreted as source data, otherwise it can be the pathname of the file or URL. If it is a pathname format, then it may contain also wildcard characters representing a group of files.
        Parameters:
        sources - The string with sources.
        sourceIds - array of names of source source data corresponding to the sources argument (any item or even this argument may be null).

      • setSource

        void setSource(java.io.File... sources)
        Add files with source data of X-definitions or collections.
        Parameters:
        sources - array of files with sources.

      • setSource

        void setSource(java.net.URL... sources)
        Add URLs with source data of X-definitions or collections.
        Parameters:
        sources - array of URLs with sources.

      • setSource

        void setSource(java.io.InputStream source,
               java.lang.String sourceId)
        Add input stream with source data of a X-definition or collection.
        Parameters:
        source - The input stream with source.
        sourceId - name of source source data corresponding to stream (may be null).

      • setSource

        void setSource(java.io.InputStream[] sources,
               java.lang.String[] sourceIds)
        Add input streams with sources data of X-definitions or collections.
        Parameters:
        sources - array of input streams with sources.
        sourceIds - array of names of source source data corresponding to streams from the argument sources (any item or even this argument may be null).

      • setClassLoader

        void setClassLoader(java.lang.ClassLoader loader)
        Set class loader. The class loader must be set before setting sources.
        Parameters:
        loader - class loader.

      • setExternals

        void setExternals(java.lang.Class<?>... extClasses)
        Set external classes with external methods.
        Parameters:
        extClasses - array of classes with external methods.

      • setReporter

        void setReporter(ReportWriter reporter)
        Set reporter. This method is should be used only for incremental message reporting. The reporter must be set before setting sources.
        Parameters:
        reporter - the reporter to be set to this builder.

      • compileXD

        XDPool compileXD()
        Build XDefPool from prepared sources.
        Returns:
        created XDefPool.
